~ (Boolean) Epoch.isArray(v)

@param v Value to test.

Returns:

  • ( Boolean ) — true if the given value is an array, false otherwise.

~ (Boolean) Epoch.isObject(v)

@param v Value to test.

Returns:

  • ( Boolean ) — true if the given value is an object, false otherwise.

~ (Boolean) Epoch.isString(v)

@param v Value to test.

Returns:

  • ( Boolean ) — true if the given value is a string, false otherwise.

~ (Boolean) Epoch.isFunction(v)

@param v Value to test.

Returns:

  • ( Boolean ) — true if the given value is a function, false otherwise.

~ (void) Epoch.warn(msg)

Sends a warning to the developer console with the given message.

Parameters:

  • msg ( String ) — Message for the warning.

~ (void) Epoch.exception(msg)

Raises an exception with the given message (with the 'Epoch Error:' preamble).

Parameters:

  • msg ( String ) — Specific message for the exception.

~ (?) Epoch.Util.copy(original)

Parameters:

  • original ( Object ) — Object for which to make the shallow copy.

Returns:

  • ( ? ) — A shallow copy of the given object.

~ (void) Epoch.Util.defaults(options, defaults)

Creates a deep copy of the given options filling in missing defaults.

Parameters:

  • options ( Object ) — Options to copy.
  • defaults ( Object ) — Default values for the options.

~ (void) Epoch.Util.formatSI(v, fixed = 1, fixIntegers = false)

Formats numbers with standard postfixes (e.g. K, M, G)

Examples:

Formatting a very large number 

Epoch.Util.formatSI(1120000) == "1.1 M"

Parameters:

  • v ( Number ) — Value to format.
  • fixed ( Integer ) — Number of floating point digits to fix after conversion.
  • fixIntegers ( Boolean ) — Whether or not to add floating point digits to non-floating point results.

~ (void) Epoch.Util.formatBytes(v, fixed = 1, fix_integers = false)

Formats large bandwidth and disk space usage numbers with byte postfixes (e.g. KB, MB, GB, etc.)

Examples:

Formatting a large number of bytes 

Epoch.Util.formatBytes(5.21 * Math.pow(2, 20)) == "5.2 MB"

Parameters:

  • v ( Number ) — Value to format.
  • fixed ( Integer ) — Number of floating point digits to fix after conversion.
  • fixIntegers ( Boolean ) — Whether or not to add floating point digits to non-floating point results.

~ (?) Epoch.Util.dasherize(str)

Examples:

Using dasherize 

Epoch.Util.dasherize('My Awesome Name') == 'my-awesome-name'

Returns:

  • ( ? ) — a "dasherized" css class names from a given string

~ (?) Epoch.Util.domain(layers, key = 'x')

Parameters:

  • layers ( Array ) — Layered plot data.
  • key ( String ) — The key name of the value at on each entry in the layers.

Returns:

  • ( ? ) — the full domain of a given variable from an array of layers

~ (?) Epoch.toRGBA(color, opacity)

Converts a CSS color string into an RGBA string with the given opacity

Parameters:

  • color ( String ) — Color string to convert into an rgba
  • opacity ( Number ) — Opacity to use for the resulting color.

Returns:

  • ( ? ) — the resulting rgba color string.
